support_summary: ATXN3 has a transient regulatory interaction with GABARAP, a member of the LC3/GABARAP protein family, during autophagy.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 engages in a transient regulatory interaction with GABARAP, an ATG8 family protein crucial for autophagosome maturation.
functions.effect_description: This interaction, occurring in the early stages of the autophagic pathway, suggests a role for ATXN3 in modulating autophagosome dynamics.
biological_consequence: ATXN3-GABARAP interaction → Regulation of autophagosome maturation → Cellular quality control
specific_effects: The interaction supports the role of ATXN3 as a positive regulator of autophagy.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

mechanism: ATXN3 engages in a transient regulatory interaction with GABARAP, an ATG8 family protein crucial for autophagosome maturation.
effect: This interaction, occurring in the early stages of the autophagic pathway, suggests a role for ATXN3 in modulating autophagosome dynamics.
summary: ATXN3 activates GABARAP to modulate autophagy, ultimately affecting cellular quality control.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
